Posts.Content: Dec 20, 2010 08:03PM Laugh-addict wrote: CrunchyPoodleMama-I think I have a similar dents on each side.  I assume it will all fill in as TE's are expanded.  Do you have a TE in place?  It must just be the way they bunch the skin back together.  I totally hear ya on obsessing on stuff.  I had some dead tissue removed last week and just got back from PS to learn he will do a touch-up tomorrow.  He is REALLY lucky I like him so much!  Good luck on your post-op tomorrow. Tina
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2010 11:16AM Laugh-addict wrote: Annie62- I packed a bunch of stuff for a 2-day hospital stay.  Only ended up using my hairbrush, disposable toothbrushes (Colgate WISP-loved them!!!), chap stick, phone charger and robe for the ride home.  It is just like packing for a vacation....but NOT! haha!  You always bring more than you need....and that is ok.  You won't have to carry the bag back out to the car. ;-). Wishing you, Megan (happy b-day!) and Barbara lots of luck tomorrow.  You will be in my thoughts!! Tina
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2010 08:56AM Laugh-addict wrote: Hello December ladies, Just wanted to check in as it has been a while.  Good luck to those heading into surgery and  and congrats to those on the other side.  I hope everyone heading into surgery is staying calm and those that are healing are getting back up and around and feeling better each day. I had some surgery to remove some "unhappy" tissue yesterday.  I love my PS!  He is just so calming and assures me that all will be well! I didn't feel a thing.  Just a bit odd to have someone working on you while you are awake, but I really got to know him in that 1-1/2 hours!  I am hoping my tissue is "happy" now! My original 2 drain tubes are still in.  He is thinking maybe next week.  I was starting to feel crunchy about it and then became thankful that there is only 2 and they are serving a very important purpose.   I can't believe we are already at December 15th.  Half way through the month.  Soon we will be those that the January gals will be looking to for support. This community is so amazing! Thank you all!! Tina
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2010 12:45PM Laugh-addict wrote: Hi December gals, Haven't checked in for a few days.  Hope everyone had a great holiday!   For some reason I have been very emotional this morning.  I can't seem to find my "big girl panties" today. I still have one drain tube in....30 days and counting.  Also have been having trouble keeping wound closed.  I guess I start to feel good then do too much. My visit on Tuesday only needed a couple stitches.  I guess it's progress huh? :) Today my break down was caused by wanting to shower.  My boyfriend found me in the bathroom crying with almost a roll of tape on me trying to cover my stitches and drain.  I felt so silly!  But he got me laughing and is on his way to the store for some supplies.  I meet with the oncologist on Tuesday to get Oncotype Dx test results then off to PS for drain removal.  Bring it on 2011!  Take care and rest easy everyone! Hugs.... Tina
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2011 04:14PM Laugh-addict wrote: vis0121- I will be doing TC X4. Probably won't start for a few weeks as I have some healing issue.  Got my last drain tube out today :-) but had to get re-stitched :-(  At least my glass is half full!!  Got the release to go back to work Monday at least for a couple weeks.  I am getting stir crazy!  It will be nice as I work with many of my close friends.    I hope everyone is doing well! Tina

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2010 11:37PM Laugh-addict wrote: Sleep well Jane!  So glad you are home. Thinking of all my gals who are done with surgery and recovering, and thinking clam thoughts for those coming up. Be well. Tina :)

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2010 09:33PM Laugh-addict wrote: Good luck to those of you heading into surgery this week and I hope those on the other side are doing great! I see the PS tomorrow to check on the "unhappy" tissue I am having trouble with. Still doesn't look good to me, but we will see what he says tomorrow.  He removed some on each side last week and re-stitched but it seems to have come back.  It is causing me anxiety, but that is nothing new! lol  :)   I am hoping to at least get one of my two tubes out as well.  Just barely at 30cc's on the left and 40cc's on the right......so I don't know.  This has been such a test of patience!!!    Thinking of you all and will touch base soon! Tina
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2011 07:25PM Laugh-addict wrote: Annie-Glad to hear you are getting back "your positive mojo!".....soooo important.  I found out Thursday I will be doing chemo too.  I scored a 27 on the Oncotye Dx test and decided it was best to do chemo.  I think I am more afraid of not doing it, than doing it.   Paula-Welcome to the other side.  May you heal beautifully and have great path results! Summer-Good luck on the final path results.  The wig party sounds like a great idea!    I have chemo class tomorrow.  My onc called in 4 prescriptions for me to bring to class.  Makes it VERY real all of a sudden! :-)  Don't know when chemo starts, but it seems as though it may be soon.  I see the PS on Tuesday in hopes to get my tube out and check out my healing. Take care December ladies.  I will check back soon. Tina

Posts.Content: Nov 26, 2010 04:04PM - edited Nov 26, 2010 04:04PM by Laugh-addict Hi Tammy, I have been practicing getting in and out of my recliner without using my arms.  Try leaving it reclined, then pushing down on the foot rest enough to get in.  I find that I can get out ok while leaving it reclined, or I can push is down enough to get out.  You have some time to practice!   My surgery is Dec 1st so I will let you all know how it works out for me. Tina  :-)
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2010 05:27PM - edited Aug 20, 2013 05:17AM by Laugh-addict Thanks for the well wishes everyone!  Good luck to my fellow December 1st gals (and November 30th) as well!  I will be in touch soon to let you all know how things went. Be well and remember to laugh!  Tina
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2010 09:25AM Laugh-addict wrote: Hello ladies!  I am home safe and sound. Everything went very smoothly.  I was nervous about the sentinel node injections which were no big deal after all.  They did numb with spray before hand.  I had a BMX with TE's.  I am sore but doing great.  Never got sick from pain meds and was up and around the next morning. My spirits have been up and I had the nurses laughing the whole time.  I think if you can keep a smile on your face it makes all the difference.  There were times when I may have put on a happy face for the benefit of others, but it ultimately felt good to wear the smile! :)  I know everyone is different and will deal with this in their own way.  Just try and reach deep down and find the positive and remember we are alive....that is why we are in pain, or fear.   Feel free to PM me if you have specific questions.   I hope my our November 30, Dec,1st, 2nd and 3rd girls are doing well.  Wishing you all the best and look forward to hearing how you all are.  Remember to laugh between the tears!  Tina :-)
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2011 08:54AM Laugh-addict wrote: Hello December ladies! Been a while since I checked in.  I am 8 weeks post BMX tomorrow. Seems like Dec 1st was just a few week ago!    I had some healing issues so was not able to start getting fills until last week.  I am now up to 250 on the left and 200 on the right.  Slow and steady wins the race! I start chemo (TC X4) on the 31st.  Getting a little anxious but overall feeling pretty good.  I was able to get in a couple weeks of work, which made a HUGE difference in my spirits.  It was great to see all my buddies.  :-) I hope everyone continues to heal as we move forward through our journeys! Take care, Tina
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Nov 21, 2010 06:56PM Laugh-addict wrote: Hello brave ladies!   You can add me to the list for December 1st.  BMX with TE.   I was first diagnosed on October 29th and have been marching forward since, trying to keep a smile on my face and hope in my heart.  I have been all over the forums and never posted until now.  I love all the great inspiration and ideas. I look forward to reading more and reaching out to all my fellow December peeps. Stay brave and laugh between the tears......   Tina (Laugh-addict)
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 22, 2010 06:02PM Laugh-addict wrote: Hi ladies, Well, I finally got one of my tubes out yesterday and will have to wait until next Tuesday to get out the second.  My surgery was December 1st. :-(  Oh well, at least I am half way there!  If felt good to sleep on my side last night.  It's the little things.  I also had to have a "touch up" to remove more unhappy tissue and just changed the dressings.  I think I may be ok this time!! There are some dark areas but much smaller.  I was so afraid all day to look and I finally found my big girl panties and put them on!!  Glad I did.  I should sleep much better tonight. :) I hope everyone is healing well and getting back on track with life. I hope everything went well for dfwgal and we will be thinking of you tomorrow beatingit2! Stay strong and find your smile. Tina :)

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2010 03:57PM Laugh-addict wrote: Dfwgal-Thanks so much for the coupons....and yes I will redeem one today!  The visual you provided had me laughing so hard.  It is just what I needed today.  Thank you!!! skhartley-Yes, BF is a keeper.  He makes me laugh every day, sometimes right in the middle of my pity party!  Good luck with the grenades!  Thanks to everyone for all your honesty and wisdom.  It has really made this whole process much easier. Hugs to all!
